column1: Bs the merger agreement is a legally binding document that outlines the terms and conditions of a merger or acquisition, the wording of the Specific Performance clause is crucial in determining the parties' entitlement in the event of a breach.

Bs the merger agreement states, "each Party shall be entitled to, in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, an injunction or injunctions, specific performance or other equitable relief to prevent breaches of this Agreement and/or to enforce specifically the terms and provisions hereof in any court." This wording indicates that the parties are entitled to seek specific performance as a remedy for breach of the agreement, which is option B
